The Solar System

The Sun

Our Sun is a 4.5 billion-year-old yellow dwarf star a hot glowing ball of hydrogen and helium at the center of our solar system

Learn More About The Sun

The Mercury

The smallest planet in our solar system.

Learn More About The Mercury

The Venus

Venus, the second planet from the sun, is the hottest and brightest planet in the solar system.

Learn More About The Venus

The Earth

Our home planet Earth is a rocky, terrestrial planet. It has a solid and active surface with mountains, valleys, canyons, plains and so much more. Earth is special because it is an ocean planet. Water covers 70% of Earth's surface.

Learn More About The Earth

Mars is a cold desert world.

The Uranus

Uranus is made of water, methane, and ammonia fluids above a small rocky center.

Learn More About The Uranus

The Neptune

Neptune is dark, cold, and very windy.

Learn More About The Neptune

The Pluto (Dwarf Planet)

Pluto is a dwarf planet in the Kuiper Belt, known for its highly elliptical orbit and former status as the ninth planet.

Learn More About The Pluto

The Moon (Earth's Natural Satellite)

The Moon is Earth's only natural satellite and plays a crucial role in regulating tides and stabilizing Earth's rotation.

Learn More About The Moon
